lead_paragraph: Relatives of Archbishop Fulton J. Sheen, well known as the host of a 1950s television show, want him to be buried in Peoria, where church officials are behind the cause for his canonization.

headline.print_headline: An Archbishop’s Niece Sues to Move His Remains From New York to Illinois
headline.main: Archbishop Sheen’s Family Sues to Move His Body, From New York to Illinois

snippet: Relatives of Archbishop Fulton J. Sheen, well known as the host of a 1950s television show, want him to be buried in Peoria, where church officials are behind the cause for his canonization.
abstract: Niece of late Archbishop Fulton J Sheen petitions New York State Supreme Court for permission to disinter his remains from St Patrick's Cathedral and transfer them to Peoria, Ill, where he was ordained; Roman Catholic Church officials in Illinois say efforts to see Sheen beatified and ultimately declared saint have been stalled because New York will not relinquish body.
